paragraphs.content: Chapter 6
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 6

paragraphs.content: But Job answered and said,
paragraphs.contentHtml: But Job answered and said,

paragraphs.content: Oh that my grief were throughly weighed, and my calamity laid in the balances together!
paragraphs.contentHtml: Oh that my grief were throughly weighed, and my calamity laid in the balances together!

paragraphs.content: For now it would be heavier than the sand of the sea: therefore my words are swallowed up.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For now it would be heavier than the sand of the sea: therefore my words are swallowed up.

paragraphs.content: For the arrows of the Almighty are within me, the poison whereof drinketh up my spirit: the terrors of God do set themselves in array against me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the arrows of the Almighty are within me, the poison whereof drinketh up my spirit: the terrors of God do set themselves in array against me.

paragraphs.content: Doth the wild ass bray when he hath grass? or loweth the ox over his fodder?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Doth the wild ass bray when he hath grass? or loweth the ox over his fodder?

paragraphs.content: Can that which is unsavoury be eaten without salt? or is there any taste in the white of an egg?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Can that which is unsavoury be eaten without salt? or is there any taste in the white of an egg?

paragraphs.content: The things that my soul refused to touch are as my sorrowful meat.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The things that my soul refused to touch are as my sorrowful meat.

paragraphs.content: Oh that I might have my request; and that God would grant me the thing that I long for!
paragraphs.contentHtml: Oh that I might have my request; and that God would grant me the thing that I long for!

paragraphs.content: Even that it would please God to destroy me; that he would let loose his hand, and cut me off!
paragraphs.contentHtml: Even that it would please God to destroy me; that he would let loose his hand, and cut me off!

paragraphs.content: Then should I yet have comfort; yea, I would harden myself in sorrow: let him not spare; for I have not concealed the words of the Holy One.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then should I yet have comfort; yea, I would harden myself in sorrow: let him not spare; for I have not concealed the words of the Holy One.

paragraphs.content: What is my strength, that I should hope? and what is mine end, that I should prolong my life?
paragraphs.contentHtml: What is my strength, that I should hope? and what is mine end, that I should prolong my life?

paragraphs.content: Is my strength the strength of stones? or is my flesh of brass?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Is my strength the strength of stones? or is my flesh of brass?

paragraphs.content: Is not my help in me? and is wisdom driven quite from me?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Is not my help in me? and is wisdom driven quite from me?

paragraphs.content: To him that is afflicted pity should be shewed from his friend; but he forsaketh the fear of the Almighty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To him that is afflicted pity should be shewed from his friend; but he forsaketh the fear of the Almighty.

paragraphs.content: My brethren have dealt deceitfully as a brook, and as the stream of brooks they pass away;
paragraphs.contentHtml: My brethren have dealt deceitfully as a brook, and as the stream of brooks they pass away;

paragraphs.content: Which are blackish by reason of the ice, and wherein the snow is hid:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which are blackish by reason of the ice, and wherein the snow is hid:

paragraphs.content: What time they wax warm, they vanish: when it is hot, they are consumed out of their place.
paragraphs.contentHtml: What time they wax warm, they vanish: when it is hot, they are consumed out of their place.

paragraphs.content: The paths of their way are turned aside; they go to nothing, and perish.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The paths of their way are turned aside; they go to nothing, and perish.

paragraphs.content: The troops of Tema looked, the companies of Sheba waited for them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The troops of Tema looked, the companies of Sheba waited for them.

paragraphs.content: They were confounded because they had hoped; they came thither, and were ashamed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They were confounded because they had hoped; they came thither, and were ashamed.

paragraphs.content: For now ye are nothing; ye see my casting down, and are afraid.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For now ye are nothing; ye see my casting down, and are afraid.

paragraphs.content: Did I say, Bring unto me? or, Give a reward for me of your substance?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Did I say, Bring unto me? or, Give a reward for me of your substance?

paragraphs.content: Or, Deliver me from the enemy’s hand? or, Redeem me from the hand of the mighty?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Or, Deliver me from the enemy’s hand? or, Redeem me from the hand of the mighty?

paragraphs.content: Teach me, and I will hold my tongue: and cause me to understand wherein I have erred.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Teach me, and I will hold my tongue: and cause me to understand wherein I have erred.

paragraphs.content: How forcible are right words! but what doth your arguing reprove?
paragraphs.contentHtml: How forcible are right words! but what doth your arguing reprove?

paragraphs.content: Do ye imagine to reprove words, and the speeches of one that is desperate, which are as wind?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Do ye imagine to reprove words, and the speeches of one that is desperate, which are as wind?

paragraphs.content: Yea, ye overwhelm the fatherless, and ye dig a pit for your friend.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, ye overwhelm the fatherless, and ye dig a pit for your friend.

paragraphs.content: Now therefore be content, look upon me; for it is evident unto you if I lie.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now therefore be content, look upon me; for it is evident unto you if I lie.

paragraphs.content: Return, I pray you, let it not be iniquity; yea, return again, my righteousness is in it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Return, I pray you, let it not be iniquity; yea, return again, my righteousness is in it.

paragraphs.content: Is there iniquity in my tongue? cannot my taste discern perverse things?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Is there iniquity in my tongue? cannot my taste discern perverse things?
